Song.title: I Stand Amazed In The Presence
Song.copyright: Words by Charles Gab­ri­el Music by Ed­win Ex­cell

Arrangement.description: Arranged by Timmy Schmidt - Alternate wording
Arrangement.text:
Verse 1: I [E]stand amazed in the presence, Of [B]Jesus the Naza[E]rene, And [A]wonder how He could [E]love me a [E/G#]sinner, con[B7]demned, un[E]clean.
Chorus: [E]How marvelous! How wonderful [B]And my song shall ever be [E]How marvelous! [E/G#]How wondeful [F#m7]Is my [E]Savior’s [B]love for [E]me!
Verse 2: For [E]me it was in the garden, He [B]prayed: Not My will, but [E]Thine He [A]did shed tears for His [E]own griefs but [E/G#]sweat drops of [B7]blood for [E]mine
Verse 4: He [E]took my sins and my sorrows He [B]made them His very own He [A]bore the burden to [E]Calvary And [E/G#]suffered and [B7]died a[E]lone
Verse 5: When [E]with the ransomed in glory His [B]face I at last shall [E]see, ’Twill [A]be my joy through the [E]ages To [E/G#]sing of His [B7]love for [E]me.
Arrangement.searchtext: verse 1 i stand amazed in the presence of jesus the nazarene and wonder how he could love me a sinner condemned unclean chorus how marvelous how wonderful and my song shall ever be how marvelous how wondeful is my saviors love for me verse 2 for me it was in the garden he prayed not my will but thine he did shed tears for his own griefs but sweat drops of blood for mine verse 4 he took my sins and my sorrows he made them his very own he bore the burden to calvary and suffered and died alone verse 5 when with the ransomed in glory his face i at last shall see twill be my joy through the ages to sing of his love for me

Arrangement.text:
Verse 1: I [G]stand amazed in [Am7]the [G]presence, Of [D]Jesus the [G/D]Na[D7]za[G]rene, And [C]wonder how [C9]He [C]could [G]love me, [C6]A [G/B]sinner, con[D7]demned, un[G]clean.
Chorus: [G]How mar[Am7/G]ve[G]lous! How won[Am7/G]der[G]ful! [D]And my song [G/B]shall [D7]e[G/B]ver [D]be: [G]How mar[Am7/G]ve[G]lous! [Em]How [G]won[Am7/G]der[G]ful! [C6]Is [CM7 C]my [G5/B]Sa[Am7]vior’s [G/B]love [D7]for [G]me!
Verse 2: For [G]me it was in [Am7]the [G]garden, He [D]prayed: Not My [G/D]will, [D7]but [G]Thine He [C]had no tears [C9]for [C]His [G]own griefs, [C6]but [G/B]sweat drops of [D7]blood for [G]mine
{new_page} Verse 3: In [G]pity angels [Am7]be[G]held Him, And [D]came from the [G/D]world [D7]of [G]light To [C]comfort Him [C9]in [C]the [G]sorrows [C6]He [G/B]bore for my [D7]soul that [G]night.
Verse 4: He [G]took my sins and [Am7]my [G]sorrows, He [D]made them His [G/D]ve[D7]ry [G]own; He [C]bore the bur[C9]den [C]to [G]Calvary, [C6]And [G/B]suffered and [D7]died a[G]lone.
Verse 5: When [G]with the ransomed [Am7]in [G]glory His [D]face I at [G/D]last [D7]shall [G]see, ’Twill [C]be my joy [C9]through [C]the [G]ages [C6]To [G/B]sing of His [D7]love for [G]me.
Arrangement.searchtext: verse 1 i stand amazed in the presence of jesus the nazarene and wonder how he could love me a sinner condemned unclean chorus how marvelous how wonderful and my song shall ever be how marvelous how wonderful is my saviors love for me verse 2 for me it was in the garden he prayed not my will but thine he had no tears for his own griefs but sweat drops of blood for mine verse 3 in pity angels beheld him and came from the world of light to comfort him in the sorrows he bore for my soul that night verse 4 he took my sins and my sorrows he made them his very own he bore the burden to calvary and suffered and died alone verse 5 when with the ransomed in glory his face i at last shall see twill be my joy through the ages to sing of his love for me

Arrangement.text:
INTRO: [G] [C] [G] [C]
Verse 1: I [G]stand amazed in the presence, Of [D]Jesus the Naza[G]rene, And [C]wonder how He could [G]love me, A sinner, con[D]demned, un[G]clean.
Chorus: [G]How marvelous! How wonderful! [D]And my song shall ever be: [G]How marvelous! [Em]How wonderful! [C]Is my Savior’s [G]love [D]for [G]me!
Verse 4: He [G]took my sins and my sorrows, He [D]made them His very [G]own; He [C]bore the burden to [G]Calvary, And suffered and [D]died a[G]lone.
{new_page} Verse 5: When [G]with the ransomed in glory His [D]face I at last shall [G]see, ’Twill [C]be my joy through the [G]ages To sing of His [D7]love for [G]me.
Bridge: [C]Forever I will [G]sing your praise, [C]Jesus, risen [G]king. [C]Oh, my God I [G]stand amazed, that you [G]love [D]me.
Arrangement.searchtext: intro verse 1 i stand amazed in the presence of jesus the nazarene and wonder how he could love me a sinner condemned unclean chorus how marvelous how wonderful and my song shall ever be how marvelous how wonderful is my saviors love for me verse 4 he took my sins and my sorrows he made them his very own he bore the burden to calvary and suffered and died alone verse 5 when with the ransomed in glory his face i at last shall see twill be my joy through the ages to sing of his love for me bridge forever i will sing your praise jesus risen king oh my god i stand amazed that you love me
